Issues.Title: feat(compiler-cli): define interfaces to be used for TemplateTypeChecker
Issues.Body:
This commit defines the interfaces which outline the information the
`TemplateTypeChecker` can return when requesting a Symbol for an item in the
`TemplateAst`.
Rather than providing the `ts.Symbol`, `ts.Type`, etc.
information in several separate functions, the `TemplateTypeChecker` can
instead provide all the useful information it knows about a particular
node in the `TemplateAst` and allow the callers to determine what to do
with it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(compiler-cli): define interfaces to be used for TemplateTypeChecker" (#38515)

Issues.Title: Attribute Binding with attr. is not working with Ivy
Issues.Body: # üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue affects the @angular/core/Directive when Ivy is enabled on the project. ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 7.2.15. When Ivy is disabled in Angular 9.x and 10.x the issue is also not present. ### Description We have a directive with two selectors [data-dl],[attr.data-dl] that creates a mousedown event on the HTML element. When Ivy is enabled on the project, the attr.data-dl version of the directive does not properly fire the mousedown event while just data-dl does fire correctly. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Right click on the links in the projects below to see the message being logged to the console. - Version with Ivy enabled that has the issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-w9bhzc - Version with Ivy disabled that works fine: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-8d6qq9 ## üî• Exception or Error No Exception ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 9.1.12 **Anything else relevant?** Seems to be broken uniformly across all browsers and operating systems from what we have seen.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Attribute Binding with attr. is not working with Ivy" (#38512)

Issues.Title: Using routerLinkActive when routerLink is dynamic causes browser to freeze
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was 10.0.9 The bug was (re)introduced with 10.0.10 but was seen before #20995 ### Description Using routerLinkActive when routerLink is dynamic causes browser to freeze ```html
{{l}}
``` ```ts import {Component} from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-root', templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.css'] }) export class AppComponent { title = 'routerlinkactive'; letters = ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd']; getMenuItem(letter: string): string[] { return ['/menu', letter]; } } ``` on each cycle getMenuItem returns a new instance of the array, causing routerLink new (https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/989e8a1 fixing this 3y old https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/18469) OnChange to be fired, then routerLinkActive updated() to be called through change subscription previously, without the OnChange, having changing references in [routerLink] was not a problem https://xkcd.com/1172/ :) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 10.0.9 version -> works : https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-rpleqb 10.0.10 version -> freezes : https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-rpleqb ## üî• Exception or Error Browser freeze (on RouterLinkActive updates) ## Solutions / workarounds - solution 1 (users) : don't use always changing references in RouterLink - maybe solution 2 (angular) : use SimpleChange values from RouterLink OnChange to check for value change in link ? even if using RouterLink with always changing reference may be a bad practice, having a browser freeze on a patch release is bad news and somewhat a regression
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Using routerLinkActive when routerLink is dynamic causes browser to freeze" (#38510)

Issues.Title: getGlobalObjects is not a function
Issues.Body:
Hi Team,

After I have upgraded my angular app from ng7 to ng8, I started receiving this error in browser console:

```
zone-legacy.js:310 Uncaught TypeError: api.getGlobalObjects is not a function
    at registerElementPatch (zone-legacy.js:310)
    at zone-legacy.js:333
    at Function.r.__load_patch (zone.min.js:1)
    at _global.__zone_symbol__legacyPatch (zone-legacy.js:332)
    at zone-evergreen.js:2820
    at Function.r.__load_patch (zone.min.js:1)
    at Object.node_modulesZoneJsDistZoneEvergreenJs (zone-evergreen.js:2817)
    at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:79)
    at Module.srcPolyfillsTs (polyfills.ts:1)
    at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:79)
```

In my polyfills.ts file, I have: 
``` 
import 'zone.js/dist/zone'; // Included with Angular CLI.
```
Installed zone.js version is 0.9.1

The application **ONLY** loads on Chrome despite the above error.

Could you please help me with this issue?

Thanks and Regards
Shaswata Mukherjee
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "getGlobalObjects is not a function" (#38506)

Issues.Title: fix(bazel): substitute local labels with `@npm//@angular/bazel` for NPM version
Issues.Body:
The fixes the below error when used with the NodeJS rules 2:

```
ERROR: in /defaults.bzl: in /1bbbf98caa40fd7ceccd451948ced2e0/
external/npm/@angular/bazel/index.bzl:
Label '@npm//src:ng_module.bzl' is invalid because 'src' is not a package;
 perhaps you meant to put the colon here: '@npm//:src/ng_module.bzl'?
```

Output before
```
# Copyright Google LLC All Rights Reserved.
#
# Use of this source code is governed by an MIT-style license that can be
# found in the LICENSE file at https://angular.io/license
""" Public API surface is re-exported here.

Users should not load files under "/src"
"""

load("//src/ng_package:ng_package.bzl", _ng_package = "ng_package")
load("//src:ng_module.bzl", _ng_module = "ng_module_macro")

ng_module = _ng_module
ng_package = _ng_package
# DO NOT ADD PUBLIC API without including in the documentation generation
# Run `yarn bazel build //docs` to verify
```

Output now
```
# Copyright Google LLC All Rights Reserved.
#
# Use of this source code is governed by an MIT-style license that can be
# found in the LICENSE file at https://angular.io/license
""" Public API surface is re-exported here.

Users should not load files under "/src"
"""

load("@npm//@angular/bazel/src/ng_package:ng_package.bzl", _ng_package = "ng_package")
load("@npm//@angular/bazel/src:ng_module.bzl", _ng_module = "ng_module_macro")

ng_module = _ng_module
ng_package = _ng_package
# DO NOT ADD PUBLIC API without including in the documentation generation
# Run `yarn bazel build @npm//@angular/bazel/docs` to verify
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(bazel): substitute local labels with `@npm//@angular/bazel` for NPM version" (#38504)

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages as the source of the bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> The issue is caused by package @angular/router.


### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> No, it wasn't working at least in v9.1.11.


### Description

<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> All kinds of exceptions can occur inside the Resolver. When Resolver detects an exception, it stops processing without routing.
However, it doesn't catch the detected exception anywhere, so it shows up as an Uncaught error in the console.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
<!--
Please create and share minimal reproduction of the issue starting with this template: https://stackblitz.com/fork/angular-ivy
-->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-8qwgvb

<!--
If StackBlitz is not suitable for reproduction of your issue, please create a minimal GitHub repository with the reproduction of the issue.
A good way to make a minimal reproduction is to create a new app via `ng new repro-app` and add the minimum possible code to show the problem.
Share the link to the repo below along with step-by-step instructions to reproduce the problem, as well as expected and actual behavior.

Issues that don't have enough info and can't be reproduced will be closed.

You can read more about issue submission guidelines here: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#-submitting-an-issue
-->

## üî• Exception or Error

This code is written in StackBlitz.

```
import { Injectable } from "@angular/core";
import { Resolve } from "@angular/router";
import { Observable, of, throwError } from "rxjs";
import { tap, catchError, flatMap } from "rxjs/operators";

@Injectable({providedIn: 'root'})
export class TestResolver implements Resolve<Observable<void>> {
  resolve(): Observable<void> {
    return of(null).pipe(
      flatMap(() => {
        return throwError(new Error('throw Error!'))
      }),
      catchError((e, caught) => {
        return throwError(e);
      })
    )
  }
}
```

```
ERROR
Error: Uncaught (in promise): Error: Error throw!
Error: Error throw!
at MergeMapSubscriber.eval [as project] (https://angular-ivy-8qwgvb.stackblitz.io/~/src/app/test/test.resolver.ts:12:38)
at MergeMapSubscriber._tryNext (https://angular-ivy-8qwgvb.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/rxjs@6.6.2/internal/operators/mergeMap.js:67:27)
at MergeMapSubscriber._next (https://angular-ivy-8qwgvb.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/rxjs@6.6.2/internal/operators/mergeMap.js:57:18)
at MergeMapSubscriber.Subscriber.next (https://angular-ivy-8qwgvb.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/rxjs@6.6.2/internal/Subscriber.js:66:18)
at Observable.eval [as _subscribe] (https://angular-ivy-8qwgvb.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/rxjs@6.6.2/internal/util/subscribeToArray.js:5:20)
at Observable._trySubscribe (https://angular-ivy-8qwgvb.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/rxjs@6.6.2/internal/Observable.js:44:25)
at Observable.subscribe (https://angular-ivy-8qwgvb.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/rxjs@6.6.2/internal/Observable.js:30:22)
at MergeMapOperator.call (https://angular-ivy-8qwgvb.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/rxjs@6.6.2/internal/operators/mergeMap.js:37:23)
at Observable.subscribe (https://angular-ivy-8qwgvb.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/rxjs@6.6.2/internal/Observable.js:25:31)
at CatchOperator.call (https://angular-ivy-8qwgvb.stackblitz.io/turbo_modules/rxjs@6.6.2/internal/operators/catchError.js:30:23)
```

Issues.Title: ERROR in node_modules/@angular/fire/firestore/firestore.module.d.ts:7:74 - error TS2314: Generic type 'ModuleWithProviders<T>' requires 1 type argument(s).
Issues.Body:
```
ERROR in node_modules/@angular/fire/firestore/firestore.module.d.ts:7:74 - error TS2314: Generic type 'ModuleWithProviders<T>' requires 1 type argument(s).
    
    7     static enablePersistence(persistenceSettings?: PersistenceSettings): ModuleWithProviders;
```

I am getting the above error on adding firebase to my Angular 10 project. (no issues with old angular 9 project).
What I am doing wrong?

**Steps I took to add firebase**

 1. *npm install firebase @angular/fire --save*

 2. *ng add @angular/fire*

 3. updated **environment.ts** 

```export const environment = {
  production: false,
  firebase: {
    apiKey: <secret> ,
    authDomain: <secret>,
    databaseURL: <secret>,
    projectId: <secret>,
    storageBucket: <secret>,
    messagingSenderId: <secret>,
    appId: <secret>,
    measurementId: <secret>
  }
}; 
```

 4. Updated **app.module.ts**

```
// Firebase imports
import { AngularFireModule } from '@angular/fire';
import { AngularFirestoreModule} from '@angular/fire/firestore';
import { environment } from '../environments/environment';

@NgModule({
  declarations: [
    AppComponent
  ],
  imports: [
    QuicklinkModule,
    BrowserModule,
    AppRoutingModule,
    BrowserAnimationsModule,
    FlexLayoutModule,
    SharedModule,

    AngularFireModule.initializeApp(environment.firebase), // Main Angular fire module
    AngularFirestoreModule
  ],
  providers: [],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent]
})
export class AppModule { }

```


> [ModuleWithProviders Migration Angular.io documentation][1]


  [1]: https://angular.io/guide/migration-module-with-providers


> Project Info 
```

Issues.Title: fix(localize): render ICU placeholders in extracted translation files
Issues.Body:
Previously placeholders were only rendered for dynamic interpolation
expressons in `$localize` tagged strings. But there are also potentially
dynamic values in ICU expressions too, so we need to render these as
placeholders when extracting i18n messages into translation files.

Fixes #38437

Issues.Title: Translations are not working after adding http interceptor in ionic/angular - SOLVED
Issues.Body: ## Current behavior The translations are working fine in local machine. But when i generate the apk using ionic and install it in device it's not working. It is throwing an error. ## Expected behavior It should also work fine without any error in mobile app as well ## How do you think that we should fix this? I am not very sure about the way to fix it. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions I added the code below. Please correct me if something is missing // THIS IS THE CODE I AM USING FOR HTTP INTERCEPTOR ``` import { Injectable } from '@angular/core'; import { HttpEvent, HttpInterceptor, HttpRequest, HttpResponse, HttpHandler, HttpErrorResponse, HTTP_INTERCEPTORS, HttpHeaders } from '@angular/common/http'; import { Router } from '@angular/router'; import { HttpClient } from '@angular/common/http'; import { Observable, throwError } from 'rxjs'; import { map, catchError } from 'rxjs/operators'; import { Storage } from '@ionic/storage'; import consts from './consts'; @Injectable() export class ApiHttpInterceptor implements HttpInterceptor { constructor(private router: Router, public http: HttpClient, public storage: Storage) { } intercept(request: HttpRequest, next: HttpHandler): Observable> { const token = this.storage.get('token'); const refreshToken = this.storage.get('refresh-token'); request = request.clone({ setHeaders: { Authorization: 'Bearer ' + token, // 'Content-Type': 'application/json', // Accept: 'application/json', }, url: request.url.indexOf('http') >= 0 ? request.url : consts.API_URL + request.url, }); return next.handle(request).pipe( map((event: HttpEvent) => { return event; }), catchError((error: HttpErrorResponse) => { console.log('HttpErrorResponse', error); if (error.status === 401) { this.storage.clear(); this.router.navigate(['/login']); } return throwError(error); }), ); } } ``` // THIS IS THE CODE I AM USING FOR TRANSLATIONS LOADER ``` export function createTranslateLoader(http: HttpClient) { return new TranslateHttpLoader(http, './assets/i18n/', '.json'); } ``` // THIS IS THE CODE I AM USING IN MY app.module.ts ``` @NgModule({ declarations: [AppComponent], entryComponents: [], imports: [ BrowserModule, IonicModule.forRoot(), AppRoutingModule, HttpClientModule, TranslateModule.forRoot({ defaultLanguage: 'en', loader: { provide: TranslateLoader, useFactory: HttpLoaderFactory, deps: [HttpClient] } }), IonicStorageModule.forRoot({ name: 'da-merchant', driverOrder: ['indexeddb', 'sqlite', 'websql'] }), ComponentsModule ], providers: [ StatusBar, SplashScreen, { provide: RouteReuseStrategy, useClass: IonicRouteStrategy }, Events, { provide: HTTP_INTERCEPTORS, useClass: ApiHttpInterceptor, multi: true, }, ], bootstrap: [AppComponent] }) ``` ## Environment ``` "@angular/common": "~9.1.6", "@angular/core": "~9.1.6", "@angular/forms": "~9.1.6", "@angular/platform-browser": "~9.1.6", "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "~9.1.6", "@angular/router": "~9.1.6", "@capacitor/android": "^2.4.0", "@capacitor/core": "2.4.0", "@capacitor/ios": "^2.4.0", "@ionic-native/core": "^5.0.7", "@ionic-native/splash-screen": "^5.0.0", "@ionic-native/status-bar": "^5.0.0", "@ionic/angular": "^5.0.0", "@ionic/storage": "^2.3.0", "@mdi/font": "^5.5.55", "@ngx-translate/core": "^13.0.0", "@ngx-translate/http-loader": "^6.0.0", "rxjs": "~6.5.1", "tslib": "^1.10.0", "zone.js": "~0.10.2" ``` Yes Browser: - [ ] Chrome (desktop) versions - ALL - [ ] Chrome (Android) version - ALL - [ ] Chrome (iOS) version - ALL For Tooling issues: - Node version: v12.18.3 - Platform: Mac Others: **The issue here is only when i run the ionic app in device after installing the apk. As i mentioned, in local env it's working fine. If i remove angular http interceptors, the translations are working fine. But i also need angular http interceptors**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Translations are not working after adding http interceptor in ionic/angular - SOLVED" (#38496)

Issues.Title: Contributions made simpler
Issues.Body:
I just finished my first contribution to the framework with a bugfix. I have a feeling the process could be improved.

# CI builds were failing because linting did not pass or files were not properly formatted

Formatting files could be automated on precommit hook. Same goes for linting. It could be autofixed or if it failed to do so, it could tell me there are issues before I've committed and pushed my changes. Not only this speeds things up for me as a contributor but it also does not waste CI resources on the cloud. There are multiple packages out there that do so, I'm sure. In my projects I use Prettier and lint-staged to only process the files that were changed in the commit.

# CI builds were failing because of wrong commit message format

Pretty sure this could also be checked on precommit hook, but I have no suggestions on the tools here. Would be better to not allow people to make wrong commit rather than force them to use advanced git techniques to revert commits and force push.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Contributions made simpler" (#38486)

Issues.Title: Support i18n message extraction with Ivy
Issues.Body:
This change adds support for extracting i18n translation messages with an Ivy enabled application. This is accomplished by using the new extraction capabilities present in the `@angular/localize` package and will require version 10.1 or later of the package.  Since this change uses an new extraction method, it currently must be enabled during extraction by using the `--ivy` flag. The flag is a precaution to prevent unintentional breakage for existing applications but will become the default behavior for all Ivy enabled applications in a future release.

Closes #18275
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Support i18n message extraction with Ivy" (#18558)

Issues.Title: Use SplitChunks to split environments in angular9, but it not work
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ x ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, Angular7 is work, Update to 9, it not work! and `ng serve` is work. ### Description Use [ngx-build-plus](https://github.com/manfredsteyer/ngx-build-plus) to extend the webpack config. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction use cli ``` ng build --prod --base-href ./ --plugin ~webpack.plugin.js ``` webpack.plugin.js ``` exports.default = { config(cfg) { const cacheGroups = cfg.optimization.splitChunks.cacheGroups; cfg.optimization.splitChunks.cacheGroups = { ...cacheGroups, appConfig: { // config split chunks: 'all', // change the initial, same too. name: 'appConfig', filename: 'app-config.js', test: /[\\/]src[\\/]environments[\\/]/, enforce: true, priority: 11, }, }; return cfg; } } ``` build log print ``` chunk {0} runtime-es2015.0dae8cbc97194c7caed4.js (runtime) 1.45 kB [entry] [rendered] chunk {0} runtime-es5.0dae8cbc97194c7caed4.js (runtime) 1.45 kB [entry] [rendered] chunk {3} polyfills-es2015.1c036d218568a752e64f.js (polyfills) 36.1 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {1} app-config.js (appConfig) 153 bytes [initial] [rendered] chunk {1} app-config.js (appConfig) 151 bytes [initial] [rendered] chunk {4} polyfills-es5.4044e9e97102e0a74ed1.js (polyfills-es5) 129 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {2} main-es2015.160b21a4fe71cb2eff38.js (main) 264 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {2} main-es5.160b21a4fe71cb2eff38.js (main) 315 kB [initial] [rendered] chunk {5} styles.09e2c710755c8867a460.css (styles) 0 bytes [initial] [rendered] ``` ## üî• Exception or Error But, index.html is not inject `app.config.js` **index.html** ``` MyProject ``` ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/core): avoid RxJS performance penalty in sync fs calls
Issues.Body:
While testing compiler performance with [ng9-aot-build-times](https://github.com/JoostK/ng9-aot-build-times) I noticed RxJS's `SafeSubscriber` to show up as hot function. I opened ReactiveX/rxjs#5646 to mitigate it, however this change cannot be accepted because it breaks a certain usage pattern. As an alternative, this PR avoids the performance penalty by switching over the anonymous observer object to use 3 separate callbacks instead, such that RxJS doesn't have to create calling context objects using slow `Object.create`.

On a new CLI app, local testing indicates that this saves about 120ms or 2%, whereas the [ng9-aot-build-times](https://github.com/JoostK/ng9-aot-build-times) repo shows approximately 2 second improvement, or ~6%.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/core): avoid RxJS performance penalty in sync fs calls" (#18549)

Issues.Title: Configurable image compression feature in CLI for commonly used file extensions
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> When we're working on any client side framework, along with main bundle size, the size of assets are equally critical. At this moment, auto image compression technique is not a part of this awesome CLI tool.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Since the compression process would be heavy depending on the size of project, we cannot keep it *mandatory* default. My proposal is to incorporate as an optional configuration in `angular.json` and use [imagemin](https://github.com/imagemin) with options to configure the quality. It will add up new dependency in CLI project but looking at desire of this function in the [closed issues](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues?q=compress+images), it is worth considering.

I'm open for contribution as major amount of work is already been done by me in various project. But I would like to initiate the discussion and get suggestions from CLI experts.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> I've been working on Angular since long time and executed many projects, every time I setup a project, it has a requirement to auto compress the images. I That's why I extended the Angular Builder with `imagemin` library to compress "SVG", "JPEG", "PNG" files. Prior to that, I created a script to incorporate it after CLI build.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Configurable image compression feature in CLI for commonly used file extensions" (#18547)

Issues.Title: feat(cdk/testing): support waiting for tasks outside angular in protractor harness environment
Issues.Body:
We added support to harnesses for waiting until all tasks outside Angular
complete. We only added this to the `TestBed` harness environment because
it was unclear how we can get this functionality work in e2e tests.

Investigation showed that we can get it to work in a similar matter
by leveraging ZoneJS. Ideally we would only inject necessary code to
intercept ZoneJS dynamically through `browser.executeScript`, but that
does not work because we'd need to intercept the root zone for e2e
tests, unlike the proxy zone in TestBed jasmine tests. The root zone
does not keep track of the current task state, so if we intercept
at any time, we do not know if there are previously scheduled tasks
that will throw off our interceptor.

Due to this, we need to ask harness consumers in e2e tests/Protractor
tests to load a separate file before loading ZoneJS. This file will
intercept ZoneJS immediately so that the e2e/protractor harness
environment can then hook into the intercepted root zone.

More details can be found in the dedicated readme attached to this
commit. See `src/cdk/testing/zone-task-interceptor/README.md`.

Resolves COMP-333. Closes #18375.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(cdk/testing): support waiting for tasks outside angular in protractor harness environment" (#20351)

Issues.Title: feat(material/menu) Added option to close menu when outside click occurs
Issues.Body:
This is addressing: https://github.com/angular/components/issues/9320 as well as other scenarios.
The reason we use backdrop for menus in our project is to make sure user will never see multiple menus at the same time, since they don't automatically close when another one is opened.

However when using backdrop you need at least two interactions to open another menu or press another button on the page.
I've added an option to Material Menu to close the menu on outside clicks with the new outsidePointerEvents obsever added earlier this summer in this pr: https://github.com/angular/components/pull/16611.

I'm not sure it this is a valid approach, but at least it's a start and I'm open to suggestions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material/menu) Added option to close menu when outside click occurs" (#20350)

Issues.Title: feat(paginator): Ability to change page size appearance
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Ability yo customize the appearance (MatFormFieldAppearance) of paginator page size options.

`<mat-paginator appearance="standard">`


#### Use Case

If you set a default appearance with `MatFormFieldDefaultOptions`, this will reflect to paginator, and there's no way to set it manualy back to default.


#### Observations

It will be really nice if we could have it in MatPaginatorDefaultOptions also. 
So we could do this to override the appearance for paginator.

```
providers: [
   {
      provide: MAT_FORM_FIELD_DEFAULT_OPTIONS,
      useValue: { appearance: 'outline' },
   },
   {
      provide: MAT_PAGINATOR_DEFAULT_OPTIONS,
      useValue: { appearance: 'standard' },
   },
],
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(paginator): Ability to change page size appearance " (#20349)

Issues.Title: fix(portal): run change detection before inserting portal content
Issues.Body:
In #16407 we made some changes where we'd run change detection after transferring the portal content to the outlet, in order to handle a case where focus traps may be attached too early. This PR reverts back to triggering change detection before moving the content, because doing it after may leave behind nodes that were inserted through `ViewContainerRef` inside one one of the init hooks. The initial focus trap issue is resolved by delaying the attachment instead.

These changes fix another issue where we were assuming that component portals can only have one root node. This is true for most cases, except for when a sibling is inserted through `ViewContainerRef`.

Finally, these changes add a `detectChanges` call before moving the contents of a component portal for consistency between portals. Previously we were only doing in for template portals.

Fixes #20343.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(portal): run change detection before inserting portal content" (#20346)

Issues.Title: Navigation arrows of mat-tab don't appear when parent container gets resized
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://github.com/ms-dosx86/mat-tabs-repro

Steps to reproduce:
1. ng serve
2. resize the jspanel

#### Actual Behavior

For now if mat-tabs component is placed in a container that can be resized, pagination of mat-tab doesn't update its view. I mean the arrows for navigating between tabs don't appear
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

I see from the source code of mat-tabs that it only updates when the window gets resized. But as you can see there are cases when mat-tab can be used in a resizable container, and mat-tab should work fine in such cases too. What if use `ResizeObserver` (if it exists) to detect changes in `MatTabHeader` or `MatPaginatedTabHeader` instead? It would reduce the number of excess checks, because if the window is resized, it doesn't mean that tabs' container is resized too. It's just my thoughts of how to fix that. Altho I checked the `ResizeObserver` +`MatPaginatedTabHeader` idea and it worked, but I'm not sure it's the best approach.

#### Environment

Full environment in the repro above
- Angular: 10
- CDK/Material: 10
- Browser(s): Chrome Version 84.0.4147.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS Catalina 10.15.6
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Navigation arrows of mat-tab don't appear when parent container gets resized " (#20340)
